snippet: In a 24-mile jump, Felix Baumgartner, a professional daredevil, became the first sky diver to break the speed of sound. “It was harder than I expected,” he said.
abstract: Austrian daredevil Felix Baumgartner becomes first sky diver to break sound barrier after plummeting to earth from an altitude of 128,100 feet, or more than 24 miles high; millions of people worldwide watch as Baumgartner ascends by helium balloon and then jumps, achieving maximum speed of 833.9 miles per hour, or Mach 1.24.

byline.contributor: Brian Stelter contributed reporting from Damascus, Md.

lead_paragraph: In a 24-mile jump, Felix Baumgartner, a professional daredevil, became the first sky diver to break the speed of sound. “It was harder than I expected,” he said.

headline.seo: Felix Baumgartner Was Just Thinking About Coming Home
headline.main: 24 Miles, 4 Minutes and 834 M.P.H., All in One Jump
headline.print_headline: 24 Miles, 4 Minutes And 834 M.P.H., All in One Jump
